message.content: In /home/ryan/erdos/conjectures/, find Lean files that deal with graph theory concepts (chromatic number, independent set, SimpleGraph). Read 2-3 of them to understand patterns used. Report back the full contents of the most relevant examples.

content.text: Good! I found many files with graph theory concepts. Let me read a few representative examples - ones that have chromatic number and SimpleGraph together, and the independent set files:

content.content:
1‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Coloring
     2‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
     3‚Üíimport Mathlib.Data.Nat.Lattice
     4‚Üíimport Mathlib.Data.Nat.Choose.Basic
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üíopen SimpleGraph
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üínoncomputable section
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üí/-!
    11‚Üí# Erd≈ës Problem #744 (Disproved)
    12‚Üí
    13‚ÜíLet k ‚â• 3 be a fixed integer. Let f_k(n) be the minimal m such that there
    14‚Üíexists a k-critical graph G on n vertices that can be made bipartite by
    15‚Üídeleting m edges. (A graph is k-critical if it has chromatic number k and
    16‚Üíevery proper subgraph has chromatic number < k.)
    17‚Üí
    18‚ÜíErd≈ës, Hajnal, and Szemer√©di [EHS82] conjectured that f_k(n) ‚Üí ‚àû as n ‚Üí ‚àû
    19‚Üífor k ‚â• 4. In particular, they asked whether f_4(n) ‚â´ log n.
    20‚Üí
    21‚ÜíThis was disproved by R√∂dl and Tuza [RoTu85], who proved that
    22‚Üíf_k(n) = C(k-1, 2) for all sufficiently large n.
    23‚Üí-/
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí/-- A graph G is k-critical if it has chromatic number exactly k (i.e., is
    26‚Üí    k-colorable but not (k-1)-colorable) and every proper subgraph (strictly
    27‚Üí    fewer edges) is (k-1)-colorable. -/
    28‚Üídef SimpleGraph.IsKCritical {V : Type*} (G : SimpleGraph V) (k : ‚Ñï) : Prop :=
    29‚Üí  G.Colorable k ‚àß ¬¨G.Colorable (k - 1) ‚àß
    30‚Üí  ‚àÄ H : SimpleGraph V, H < G ‚Üí H.Colorable (k - 1)
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí/-- The minimum number of edges to delete from G to make it bipartite
    33‚Üí    (2-colorable). Defined as the infimum over cardinalities of edge sets
    34‚Üí    whose removal yields a 2-colorable graph. -/
    35‚Üídef SimpleGraph.minEdgesToBipartite {V : Type*} [DecidableEq V]
    36‚Üí    (G : SimpleGraph V) : ‚Ñï :=
    37‚Üí  sInf {m : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ S : Finset (Sym2 V), S.card = m ‚àß
    38‚Üí    (G.deleteEdges (‚ÜëS : Set (Sym2 V))).Colorable 2}
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí/-- f_k(n): the minimum, over all k-critical graphs G on n vertices, of the
    41‚Üí    minimum number of edges to delete from G to make it bipartite. -/
    42‚Üídef erdos744_fk (k n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñï :=
    43‚Üí  sInf {m : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ G : SimpleGraph (Fin n),
    44‚Üí    G.IsKCritical k ‚àß G.minEdgesToBipartite = m}
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí/--
    47‚ÜíErd≈ës Problem #744 (Disproved) [Er81, EHS82]:
    48‚Üí
    49‚ÜíThe original conjecture asked: is it true that f_k(n) ‚Üí ‚àû as n ‚Üí ‚àû for k ‚â• 4?
    50‚ÜíIn particular, is it true that f_4(n) ‚â´ log n?
    51‚Üí
    52‚ÜíR√∂dl and Tuza [RoTu85] disproved this by showing that f_k(n) = C(k-1, 2)
    53‚Üífor all sufficiently large n.
    54‚Üí-/
    55‚Üítheorem erdos_problem_744 (k : ‚Ñï) (hk : k ‚â• 3) :
    56‚Üí    ‚àÉ N‚ÇÄ : ‚Ñï, ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, n ‚â• N‚ÇÄ ‚Üí
    57‚Üí      erdos744_fk k n = Nat.choose (k - 1) 2 :=
    58‚Üí  sorry
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üíend
    61‚Üí

1‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
     2‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Coloring
     3‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Walks.Basic
     4‚Üíimport Mathlib.SetTheory.Cardinal.Aleph
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üíopen SimpleGraph Cardinal
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíuniverse u
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üínoncomputable section
    11‚Üí
    12‚Üí/-!
    13‚Üí# Erd≈ës Problem #740
    14‚Üí
    15‚ÜíLet ùî™ be an infinite cardinal and G be a graph with chromatic number ùî™.
    16‚ÜíLet r ‚â• 1. Must G contain a subgraph of chromatic number ùî™ which does not
    17‚Üícontain any odd cycle of length ‚â§ r?
    18‚Üí
    19‚ÜíA question of Erd≈ës and Hajnal [Er69b][Er71,p.100][Er81][Er95d].
    20‚ÜíR√∂dl proved this is true if ùî™ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ and r = 3 (see [108] for the finitary
    21‚Üíversion).
    22‚Üí
    23‚ÜíMore generally, Erd≈ës and Hajnal asked whether for every cardinal ùî™ and
    24‚Üíinteger r, there exists f_r(ùî™) such that every graph with chromatic number
    25‚Üí‚â• f_r(ùî™) contains a subgraph with chromatic number ùî™ with no odd cycle
    26‚Üíof length ‚â§ r.
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üíhttps://www.erdosproblems.com/740
    29‚Üí-/
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí/-- The cardinal chromatic number of a graph: the infimum of cardinals Œ∫
    32‚Üí    for which G admits a proper Œ∫-coloring. -/
    33‚Üínoncomputable def SimpleGraph.cardChromaticNumber {V : Type u}
    34‚Üí    (G : SimpleGraph V) : Cardinal.{u} :=
    35‚Üí  sInf {Œ∫ : Cardinal.{u} | ‚àÉ (Œ± : Type u), #Œ± = Œ∫ ‚àß Nonempty (G.Coloring Œ±)}
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí/--
    38‚ÜíErd≈ës Problem #740 [Er69b][Er71][Er81][Er95d]:
    39‚Üí
    40‚ÜíIf G is a graph with infinite chromatic number ùî™, then for every r ‚â• 1,
    41‚ÜíG contains a subgraph with chromatic number ùî™ that has no odd cycle of
    42‚Üílength ‚â§ r.
    43‚Üí
    44‚ÜíA question of Erd≈ës and Hajnal. R√∂dl proved the case ùî™ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ, r = 3.
    45‚Üí-/
    46‚Üítheorem erdos_problem_740 {V : Type u} (G : SimpleGraph V)
    47‚Üí    (ùî™ : Cardinal.{u}) (hùî™_inf : ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ ‚â§ ùî™)
    48‚Üí    (hœá : G.cardChromaticNumber = ùî™) (r : ‚Ñï) (hr : 1 ‚â§ r) :
    49‚Üí    ‚àÉ (W : Type u) (H : SimpleGraph W),
    50‚Üí      H.cardChromaticNumber = ùî™ ‚àß
    51‚Üí      (‚àÉ f : W ‚Üí V, Function.Injective f ‚àß ‚àÄ a b, H.Adj a b ‚Üí G.Adj (f a) (f b)) ‚àß
    52‚Üí      (‚àÄ (w : W) (p : H.Walk w w), p.IsCycle ‚Üí Odd p.length ‚Üí r < p.length) :=
    53‚Üí  sorry
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üíend
    56‚Üí

1‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique
     2‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Finite
     3‚Üíimport Mathlib.Data.Real.Basic
     4‚Üíimport Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Log.Basic
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üíopen SimpleGraph Classical
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üínoncomputable section
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üí/-!
    11‚Üí# Erd≈ës Problem #615
    12‚Üí
    13‚ÜíDoes there exist some constant c > 0 such that if G is a graph with n vertices
    14‚Üíand ‚â• (1/8 - c)n¬≤ edges then G must contain either a K‚ÇÑ or an independent set
    15‚Üíon at least n / log n vertices?
    16‚Üí
    17‚ÜíEquivalently, if rt(n; k, ‚Ñì) denotes the Ramsey-Tur√°n number (maximum number of
    18‚Üíedges in a K_k-free graph on n vertices with independence number < ‚Ñì), the
    19‚Üíquestion asks whether rt(n; 4, ‚åàn / log n‚åâ) < (1/8 - c)n¬≤ for some c > 0.
    20‚Üí
    21‚ÜíA problem of Erd≈ës, Hajnal, Simonovits, S√≥s, and Szemer√©di [EHSSS93].
    22‚Üí
    23‚ÜíErd≈ës, Hajnal, S√≥s, and Szemer√©di [EHSS83] proved that for any fixed Œµ > 0,
    24‚Üí  rt(n; 4, Œµn) < (1/8 + o(1))n¬≤.
    25‚Üí
    26‚ÜíSudakov [Su03] proved that rt(n; 4, n¬∑e^{-f(n)}) = o(n¬≤) whenever
    27‚Üí  f(n)/‚àö(log n) ‚Üí ‚àû.
    28‚Üí
    29‚ÜíDisproved by Fox, Loh, and Zhao [FLZ15], who showed that
    30‚Üí  rt(n; 4, n¬∑e^{-f(n)}) ‚â• (1/8 - o(1))n¬≤
    31‚Üíwhenever f(n) = o(‚àö(log n / log log n)).
    32‚Üí
    33‚ÜíTags: graph theory, ramsey theory
    34‚Üí-/
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí/-- A set of vertices is independent in G if no two distinct vertices in the set
    37‚Üí    are adjacent. -/
    38‚Üídef IsIndependentSet {V : Type*} (G : SimpleGraph V) (S : Finset V) : Prop :=
    39‚Üí  ‚àÄ u ‚àà S, ‚àÄ v ‚àà S, u ‚â† v ‚Üí ¬¨G.Adj u v
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí/-- The Ramsey-Tur√°n number rt(n; k, ‚Ñì): the maximum number of edges in a graph
    42‚Üí    on n vertices that contains no k-clique and has no independent set of size ‚â• ‚Ñì.
    43‚Üí    Returns 0 if no such graph exists. -/
    44‚Üínoncomputable def ramseyTuranNumber (n k ‚Ñì : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñï :=
    45‚Üí  sSup {m : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ G : SimpleGraph (Fin n),
    46‚Üí    G.edgeFinset.card = m ‚àß G.CliqueFree k ‚àß
    47‚Üí    ‚àÄ S : Finset (Fin n), IsIndependentSet G S ‚Üí S.card < ‚Ñì}
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí/--
    50‚Üí**Erd≈ës Problem #615** (DISPROVED) [EHSSS93]:
    51‚Üí
    52‚ÜíThere does NOT exist c > 0 such that for all sufficiently large n, every graph G
    53‚Üíon n vertices with at least (1/8 - c)n¬≤ edges contains either a K‚ÇÑ or an
    54‚Üíindependent set of size at least n / log n.
    55‚Üí
    56‚ÜíDisproved by Fox, Loh, and Zhao [FLZ15].
    57‚Üí-/
    58‚Üítheorem erdos_problem_615 :
    59‚Üí    ¬¨ ‚àÉ c : ‚Ñù, c > 0 ‚àß ‚àÉ N‚ÇÄ : ‚Ñï, ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, n ‚â• N‚ÇÄ ‚Üí
    60‚Üí      ‚àÄ G : SimpleGraph (Fin n),
    61‚Üí        (G.edgeFinset.card : ‚Ñù) ‚â• (1 / 8 - c) * (n : ‚Ñù) ^ 2 ‚Üí
    62‚Üí        (¬¨G.CliqueFree 4) ‚à®
    63‚Üí        ‚àÉ S : Finset (Fin n), (S.card : ‚Ñù) ‚â• (n : ‚Ñù) / Real.log (n : ‚Ñù) ‚àß
    64‚Üí          IsIndependentSet G S :=
    65‚Üí  sorry
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí/--
    68‚Üí**Erd≈ës-Hajnal-S√≥s-Szemer√©di** [EHSS83]:
    69‚Üí
    70‚ÜíFor any fixed Œµ > 0, every K‚ÇÑ-free graph on n vertices with independence
    71‚Üínumber < Œµn has fewer than (1/8 + o(1))n¬≤ edges.
    72‚Üí-/
    73‚Üítheorem erdos_problem_615_EHSS (Œµ : ‚Ñù) (hŒµ : Œµ > 0) :
    74‚Üí    ‚àÄ Œ¥ : ‚Ñù, Œ¥ > 0 ‚Üí ‚àÉ N‚ÇÄ : ‚Ñï, ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, n ‚â• N‚ÇÄ ‚Üí
    75‚Üí      ‚àÄ G : SimpleGraph (Fin n),
    76‚Üí        G.CliqueFree 4 ‚Üí
    77‚Üí        (‚àÄ S : Finset (Fin n), IsIndependentSet G S ‚Üí (S.card : ‚Ñù) < Œµ * (n : ‚Ñù)) ‚Üí
    78‚Üí        (G.edgeFinset.card : ‚Ñù) ‚â§ (1 / 8 + Œ¥) * (n : ‚Ñù) ^ 2 :=
    79‚Üí  sorry
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üíend
    82‚Üí

1‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
     2‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique
     3‚Üíimport Mathlib.Data.Finset.Basic
     4‚Üíimport Mathlib.Data.Set.Card
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üíopen SimpleGraph
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üínoncomputable section
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üí/-!
    11‚Üí# Erd≈ës Problem #151
    12‚Üí
    13‚ÜíFor a graph G let œÑ(G) denote the minimal number of vertices that include
    14‚Üíat least one from each maximal clique of G on at least two vertices
    15‚Üí(sometimes called the clique transversal number).
    16‚Üí
    17‚ÜíLet H(n) be maximal such that every triangle-free graph on n vertices
    18‚Üícontains an independent set on H(n) vertices.
    19‚Üí
    20‚ÜíConjecture: If G is a graph on n vertices then œÑ(G) ‚â§ n - H(n).
    21‚Üí
    22‚Üí[Er88, p.82] [EGT92, p.280]
    23‚Üí-/
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí/-- S is a maximal clique of G (represented as a Finset): it is a clique and
    26‚Üí    no vertex outside S can be added while preserving the clique property. -/
    27‚Üídef IsMaximalCliqueFS {n : ‚Ñï} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) (S : Finset (Fin n)) : Prop :=
    28‚Üí  G.IsClique (S : Set (Fin n)) ‚àß
    29‚Üí  ‚àÄ v : Fin n, v ‚àâ S ‚Üí ¬¨G.IsClique (‚Üë(insert v S) : Set (Fin n))
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí/-- T is a clique transversal of G if T has non-empty intersection with every
    32‚Üí    maximal clique of G that has at least 2 vertices. -/
    33‚Üídef IsCliqueTransversal {n : ‚Ñï} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) (T : Finset (Fin n)) : Prop :=
    34‚Üí  ‚àÄ S : Finset (Fin n), IsMaximalCliqueFS G S ‚Üí 2 ‚â§ S.card ‚Üí (T ‚à© S).Nonempty
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí/-- The clique transversal number œÑ(G): the minimum cardinality of a clique
    37‚Üí    transversal of G. -/
    38‚Üínoncomputable def cliqueTransversalNumber {n : ‚Ñï} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) : ‚Ñï :=
    39‚Üí  sInf { k : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ T : Finset (Fin n), IsCliqueTransversal G T ‚àß T.card = k }
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí/-- S is an independent set in G: no two distinct vertices of S are adjacent. -/
    42‚Üídef IsIndependentSet {n : ‚Ñï} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) (S : Finset (Fin n)) : Prop :=
    43‚Üí  ‚àÄ u v : Fin n, u ‚àà S ‚Üí v ‚àà S ‚Üí u ‚â† v ‚Üí ¬¨G.Adj u v
    44‚Üí
    45‚Üí/-- The independence number Œ±(G): the maximum cardinality of an independent set. -/
    46‚Üínoncomputable def independenceNumber {n : ‚Ñï} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) : ‚Ñï :=
    47‚Üí  sSup { k : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ S : Finset (Fin n), IsIndependentSet G S ‚àß S.card = k }
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí/-- H(n) is maximal such that every triangle-free graph on n vertices contains
    50‚Üí    an independent set of size H(n); equivalently, H(n) is the minimum
    51‚Üí    independence number over all triangle-free graphs on n vertices. -/
    52‚Üínoncomputable def H (n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñï :=
    53‚Üí  sInf { k : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ G : SimpleGraph (Fin n), G.CliqueFree 3 ‚àß independenceNumber G = k }
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí/--
    56‚ÜíErd≈ës Problem #151 [Er88, p.82] [EGT92, p.280] (problem of Erd≈ës and Gallai):
    57‚ÜíIf G is a graph on n vertices then œÑ(G) ‚â§ n - H(n),
    58‚Üíwhere œÑ(G) is the clique transversal number of G and H(n) is the maximum k
    59‚Üísuch that every triangle-free graph on n vertices contains an independent set
    60‚Üíof size k.
    61‚Üí-/
    62‚Üítheorem erdos_problem_151 :
    63‚Üí    ‚àÄ (n : ‚Ñï) (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)),
    64‚Üí      cliqueTransversalNumber G ‚â§ n - H n :=
    65‚Üí  sorry
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üíend
    68‚Üí

content.text: Perfect! Now let me read one more example that combines SimpleGraph with chromatic number to get another pattern:

content.content:
1‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
     2‚Üíimport Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Coloring
     3‚Üíimport Mathlib.SetTheory.Cardinal.Aleph
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üíopen SimpleGraph Cardinal
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üíuniverse u
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üínoncomputable section
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí/-!
    12‚Üí# Erd≈ës Problem #739
    13‚Üí
    14‚ÜíLet ùî™ be an infinite cardinal and G be a graph with chromatic number ùî™.
    15‚ÜíIs it true that, for every infinite cardinal ùî´ < ùî™, there exists a subgraph
    16‚Üíof G with chromatic number ùî´?
    17‚Üí
    18‚ÜíA question of Galvin [Ga73], who proved this is true with ùî™ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ.
    19‚ÜíKomj√°th [Ko88b] proved it is consistent that the answer is no
    20‚Üí(with ùî™ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÇ and ùî´ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÅ). Shelah [Sh90] proved that assuming V = L,
    21‚Üíthe answer is yes with ùî™ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÇ and ùî´ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÅ.
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üíhttps://www.erdosproblems.com/739
    24‚Üí-/
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üí/-- The cardinal chromatic number of a graph: the infimum of cardinals Œ∫
    27‚Üí    for which G admits a proper Œ∫-coloring. -/
    28‚Üínoncomputable def SimpleGraph.cardChromaticNumber {V : Type u}
    29‚Üí    (G : SimpleGraph V) : Cardinal.{u} :=
    30‚Üí  sInf {Œ∫ : Cardinal.{u} | ‚àÉ (Œ± : Type u), #Œ± = Œ∫ ‚àß Nonempty (G.Coloring Œ±)}
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí/--
    33‚ÜíErd≈ës Problem #739 [Er81]:
    34‚Üí
    35‚ÜíIf G is a graph with infinite chromatic number ùî™, then for every infinite
    36‚Üícardinal ùî´ < ùî™, there is a subgraph of G with chromatic number ùî´.
    37‚Üí
    38‚ÜíA question of Galvin, who proved the case ùî™ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ. This is not provable
    39‚Üíin ZFC: Komj√°th showed it is consistent that the answer is no.
    40‚Üí-/
    41‚Üítheorem erdos_problem_739 {V : Type u} (G : SimpleGraph V)
    42‚Üí    (ùî™ : Cardinal.{u}) (hùî™_inf : ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ ‚â§ ùî™)
    43‚Üí    (hœá : G.cardChromaticNumber = ùî™) :
    44‚Üí    ‚àÄ (ùî´ : Cardinal.{u}), ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ ‚â§ ùî´ ‚Üí ùî´ < ùî™ ‚Üí
    45‚Üí    ‚àÉ (W : Type u) (H : SimpleGraph W),
    46‚Üí      H.cardChromaticNumber = ùî´ ‚àß
    47‚Üí      ‚àÉ f : W ‚Üí V, Function.Injective f ‚àß ‚àÄ a b, H.Adj a b ‚Üí G.Adj (f a) (f b) :=
    48‚Üí  sorry
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üíend
    51‚Üí

content.text:
Excellent! I now have a comprehensive understanding of the patterns. Let me provide you with a complete report:

## Summary of Graph Theory Lean Files in `/home/ryan/erdos/conjectures/`

I found substantial graph theory content in this repository. Here are the key findings:

### File Statistics
- **ChromaticNumber/chromatic references**: 64 files
- **IndependentSet references**: 2 files (151.lean, 615.lean)
- **SimpleGraph references**: 118 files

### Common Patterns Used

The files demonstrate several consistent patterns for graph theory formalization:

1. **Imports**: All files import from `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.*` with specialized modules for different concepts:
   - `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic` (core definitions)
   - `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Coloring` (chromatic concepts)
   - `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique` (clique-related)
   - `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Finite` (finite graphs)

2. **Graph Representation**: Uses `SimpleGraph` type class with vertex type parameter, e.g., `SimpleGraph V`, `SimpleGraph (Fin n)`

3. **Key Definitions**: Custom predicates and functions defined for specific problems

---

## Most Relevant Examples - Full Contents

### 1. `/home/ryan/erdos/conjectures/744.lean` - K-Critical Graphs & Edge Deletion

```lean
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Coloring
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
import Mathlib.Data.Nat.Lattice
import Mathlib.Data.Nat.Choose.Basic

open SimpleGraph

noncomputable section

/-!
# Erd≈ës Problem #744 (Disproved)

Let k ‚â• 3 be a fixed integer. Let f_k(n) be the minimal m such that there
exists a k-critical graph G on n vertices that can be made bipartite by
deleting m edges. (A graph is k-critical if it has chromatic number k and
every proper subgraph has chromatic number < k.)

Erd≈ës, Hajnal, and Szemer√©di [EHS82] conjectured that f_k(n) ‚Üí ‚àû as n ‚Üí ‚àû
for k ‚â• 4. In particular, they asked whether f_4(n) ‚â´ log n.

This was disproved by R√∂dl and Tuza [RoTu85], who proved that
f_k(n) = C(k-1, 2) for all sufficiently large n.
-/

/-- A graph G is k-critical if it has chromatic number exactly k (i.e., is
    k-colorable but not (k-1)-colorable) and every proper subgraph (strictly
    fewer edges) is (k-1)-colorable. -/
def SimpleGraph.IsKCritical {V : Type*} (G : SimpleGraph V) (k : ‚Ñï) : Prop :=
  G.Colorable k ‚àß ¬¨G.Colorable (k - 1) ‚àß
  ‚àÄ H : SimpleGraph V, H < G ‚Üí H.Colorable (k - 1)

/-- The minimum number of edges to delete from G to make it bipartite
    (2-colorable). Defined as the infimum over cardinalities of edge sets
    whose removal yields a 2-colorable graph. -/
def SimpleGraph.minEdgesToBipartite {V : Type*} [DecidableEq V]
    (G : SimpleGraph V) : ‚Ñï :=
  sInf {m : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ S : Finset (Sym2 V), S.card = m ‚àß
    (G.deleteEdges (‚ÜëS : Set (Sym2 V))).Colorable 2}

/-- f_k(n): the minimum, over all k-critical graphs G on n vertices, of the
    minimum number of edges to delete from G to make it bipartite. -/
def erdos744_fk (k n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñï :=
  sInf {m : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ G : SimpleGraph (Fin n),
    G.IsKCritical k ‚àß G.minEdgesToBipartite = m}

/--
Erd≈ës Problem #744 (Disproved) [Er81, EHS82]:

The original conjecture asked: is it true that f_k(n) ‚Üí ‚àû as n ‚Üí ‚àû for k ‚â• 4?
In particular, is it true that f_4(n) ‚â´ log n?

R√∂dl and Tuza [RoTu85] disproved this by showing that f_k(n) = C(k-1, 2)
for all sufficiently large n.
-/
theorem erdos_problem_744 (k : ‚Ñï) (hk : k ‚â• 3) :
    ‚àÉ N‚ÇÄ : ‚Ñï, ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, n ‚â• N‚ÇÄ ‚Üí
      erdos744_fk k n = Nat.choose (k - 1) 2 :=
  sorry

end
```

---

### 2. `/home/ryan/erdos/conjectures/740.lean` - Cardinal Chromatic Number & Cycles

```lean
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Coloring
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Walks.Basic
import Mathlib.SetTheory.Cardinal.Aleph

open SimpleGraph Cardinal

universe u

noncomputable section

/-!
# Erd≈ës Problem #740

Let ùî™ be an infinite cardinal and G be a graph with chromatic number ùî™.
Let r ‚â• 1. Must G contain a subgraph of chromatic number ùî™ which does not
contain any odd cycle of length ‚â§ r?

A question of Erd≈ës and Hajnal [Er69b][Er71,p.100][Er81][Er95d].
R√∂dl proved this is true if ùî™ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ and r = 3 (see [108] for the finitary
version).

More generally, Erd≈ës and Hajnal asked whether for every cardinal ùî™ and
integer r, there exists f_r(ùî™) such that every graph with chromatic number
‚â• f_r(ùî™) contains a subgraph with chromatic number ùî™ with no odd cycle
of length ‚â§ r.

https://www.erdosproblems.com/740
-/

/-- The cardinal chromatic number of a graph: the infimum of cardinals Œ∫
    for which G admits a proper Œ∫-coloring. -/
noncomputable def SimpleGraph.cardChromaticNumber {V : Type u}
    (G : SimpleGraph V) : Cardinal.{u} :=
  sInf {Œ∫ : Cardinal.{u} | ‚àÉ (Œ± : Type u), #Œ± = Œ∫ ‚àß Nonempty (G.Coloring Œ±)}

/--
Erd≈ës Problem #740 [Er69b][Er71][Er81][Er95d]:

If G is a graph with infinite chromatic number ùî™, then for every r ‚â• 1,
G contains a subgraph with chromatic number ùî™ that has no odd cycle of
length ‚â§ r.

A question of Erd≈ës and Hajnal. R√∂dl proved the case ùî™ = ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ, r = 3.
-/
theorem erdos_problem_740 {V : Type u} (G : SimpleGraph V)
    (ùî™ : Cardinal.{u}) (hùî™_inf : ‚Ñµ‚ÇÄ ‚â§ ùî™)
    (hœá : G.cardChromaticNumber = ùî™) (r : ‚Ñï) (hr : 1 ‚â§ r) :
    ‚àÉ (W : Type u) (H : SimpleGraph W),
      H.cardChromaticNumber = ùî™ ‚àß
      (‚àÉ f : W ‚Üí V, Function.Injective f ‚àß ‚àÄ a b, H.Adj a b ‚Üí G.Adj (f a) (f b)) ‚àß
      (‚àÄ (w : W) (p : H.Walk w w), p.IsCycle ‚Üí Odd p.length ‚Üí r < p.length) :=
  sorry

end
```

---

### 3. `/home/ryan/erdos/conjectures/615.lean` - Independent Sets & Ramsey-Tur√°n

```lean
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Finite
import Mathlib.Data.Real.Basic
import Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Log.Basic

open SimpleGraph Classical

noncomputable section

/-!
# Erd≈ës Problem #615

Does there exist some constant c > 0 such that if G is a graph with n vertices
and ‚â• (1/8 - c)n¬≤ edges then G must contain either a K‚ÇÑ or an independent set
on at least n / log n vertices?

Equivalently, if rt(n; k, ‚Ñì) denotes the Ramsey-Tur√°n number (maximum number of
edges in a K_k-free graph on n vertices with independence number < ‚Ñì), the
question asks whether rt(n; 4, ‚åàn / log n‚åâ) < (1/8 - c)n¬≤ for some c > 0.

A problem of Erd≈ës, Hajnal, Simonovits, S√≥s, and Szemer√©di [EHSSS93].

Erd≈ës, Hajnal, S√≥s, and Szemer√©di [EHSS83] proved that for any fixed Œµ > 0,
  rt(n; 4, Œµn) < (1/8 + o(1))n¬≤.

Sudakov [Su03] proved that rt(n; 4, n¬∑e^{-f(n)}) = o(n¬≤) whenever
  f(n)/‚àö(log n) ‚Üí ‚àû.

Disproved by Fox, Loh, and Zhao [FLZ15], who showed that
  rt(n; 4, n¬∑e^{-f(n)}) ‚â• (1/8 - o(1))n¬≤
whenever f(n) = o(‚àö(log n / log log n)).

Tags: graph theory, ramsey theory
-/

/-- A set of vertices is independent in G if no two distinct vertices in the set
    are adjacent. -/
def IsIndependentSet {V : Type*} (G : SimpleGraph V) (S : Finset V) : Prop :=
  ‚àÄ u ‚àà S, ‚àÄ v ‚àà S, u ‚â† v ‚Üí ¬¨G.Adj u v

/-- The Ramsey-Tur√°n number rt(n; k, ‚Ñì): the maximum number of edges in a graph
    on n vertices that contains no k-clique and has no independent set of size ‚â• ‚Ñì.
    Returns 0 if no such graph exists. -/
noncomputable def ramseyTuranNumber (n k ‚Ñì : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñï :=
  sSup {m : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ G : SimpleGraph (Fin n),
    G.edgeFinset.card = m ‚àß G.CliqueFree k ‚àß
    ‚àÄ S : Finset (Fin n), IsIndependentSet G S ‚Üí S.card < ‚Ñì}

/--
**Erd≈ës Problem #615** (DISPROVED) [EHSSS93]:

There does NOT exist c > 0 such that for all sufficiently large n, every graph G
on n vertices with at least (1/8 - c)n¬≤ edges contains either a K‚ÇÑ or an
independent set of size at least n / log n.

Disproved by Fox, Loh, and Zhao [FLZ15].
-/
theorem erdos_problem_615 :
    ¬¨ ‚àÉ c : ‚Ñù, c > 0 ‚àß ‚àÉ N‚ÇÄ : ‚Ñï, ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, n ‚â• N‚ÇÄ ‚Üí
      ‚àÄ G : SimpleGraph (Fin n),
        (G.edgeFinset.card : ‚Ñù) ‚â• (1 / 8 - c) * (n : ‚Ñù) ^ 2 ‚Üí
        (¬¨G.CliqueFree 4) ‚à®
        ‚àÉ S : Finset (Fin n), (S.card : ‚Ñù) ‚â• (n : ‚Ñù) / Real.log (n : ‚Ñù) ‚àß
          IsIndependentSet G S :=
  sorry

/--
**Erd≈ës-Hajnal-S√≥s-Szemer√©di** [EHSS83]:

For any fixed Œµ > 0, every K‚ÇÑ-free graph on n vertices with independence
number < Œµn has fewer than (1/8 + o(1))n¬≤ edges.
-/
theorem erdos_problem_615_EHSS (Œµ : ‚Ñù) (hŒµ : Œµ > 0) :
    ‚àÄ Œ¥ : ‚Ñù, Œ¥ > 0 ‚Üí ‚àÉ N‚ÇÄ : ‚Ñï, ‚àÄ n : ‚Ñï, n ‚â• N‚ÇÄ ‚Üí
      ‚àÄ G : SimpleGraph (Fin n),
        G.CliqueFree 4 ‚Üí
        (‚àÄ S : Finset (Fin n), IsIndependentSet G S ‚Üí (S.card : ‚Ñù) < Œµ * (n : ‚Ñù)) ‚Üí
        (G.edgeFinset.card : ‚Ñù) ‚â§ (1 / 8 + Œ¥) * (n : ‚Ñù) ^ 2 :=
  sorry

end
```

---

### 4. `/home/ryan/erdos/conjectures/151.lean` - Independent Sets & Clique Transversals

```lean
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Basic
import Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Clique
import Mathlib.Data.Finset.Basic
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Card

open SimpleGraph

noncomputable section

/-!
# Erd≈ës Problem #151

For a graph G let œÑ(G) denote the minimal number of vertices that include
at least one from each maximal clique of G on at least two vertices
(sometimes called the clique transversal number).

Let H(n) be maximal such that every triangle-free graph on n vertices
contains an independent set on H(n) vertices.

Conjecture: If G is a graph on n vertices then œÑ(G) ‚â§ n - H(n).

[Er88, p.82] [EGT92, p.280]
-/

/-- S is a maximal clique of G (represented as a Finset): it is a clique and
    no vertex outside S can be added while preserving the clique property. -/
def IsMaximalCliqueFS {n : ‚Ñï} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) (S : Finset (Fin n)) : Prop :=
  G.IsClique (S : Set (Fin n)) ‚àß
  ‚àÄ v : Fin n, v ‚àâ S ‚Üí ¬¨G.IsClique (‚Üë(insert v S) : Set (Fin n))

/-- T is a clique transversal of G if T has non-empty intersection with every
    maximal clique of G that has at least 2 vertices. -/
def IsCliqueTransversal {n : ‚Ñï} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) (T : Finset (Fin n)) : Prop :=
  ‚àÄ S : Finset (Fin n), IsMaximalCliqueFS G S ‚Üí 2 ‚â§ S.card ‚Üí (T ‚à© S).Nonempty

/-- The clique transversal number œÑ(G): the minimum cardinality of a clique
    transversal of G. -/
noncomputable def cliqueTransversalNumber {n : ‚Ñï} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) : ‚Ñï :=
  sInf { k : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ T : Finset (Fin n), IsCliqueTransversal G T ‚àß T.card = k }

/-- S is an independent set in G: no two distinct vertices of S are adjacent. -/
def IsIndependentSet {n : ‚Ñï} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) (S : Finset (Fin n)) : Prop :=
  ‚àÄ u v : Fin n, u ‚àà S ‚Üí v ‚àà S ‚Üí u ‚â† v ‚Üí ¬¨G.Adj u v

/-- The independence number Œ±(G): the maximum cardinality of an independent set. -/
noncomputable def independenceNumber {n : ‚Ñï} (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)) : ‚Ñï :=
  sSup { k : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ S : Finset (Fin n), IsIndependentSet G S ‚àß S.card = k }

/-- H(n) is maximal such that every triangle-free graph on n vertices contains
    an independent set of size H(n); equivalently, H(n) is the minimum
    independence number over all triangle-free graphs on n vertices. -/
noncomputable def H (n : ‚Ñï) : ‚Ñï :=
  sInf { k : ‚Ñï | ‚àÉ G : SimpleGraph (Fin n), G.CliqueFree 3 ‚àß independenceNumber G = k }

/--
Erd≈ës Problem #151 [Er88, p.82] [EGT92, p.280] (problem of Erd≈ës and Gallai):
If G is a graph on n vertices then œÑ(G) ‚â§ n - H(n),
where œÑ(G) is the clique transversal number of G and H(n) is the maximum k
such that every triangle-free graph on n vertices contains an independent set
of size k.
-/
theorem erdos_problem_151 :
    ‚àÄ (n : ‚Ñï) (G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)),
      cliqueTransversalNumber G ‚â§ n - H n :=
  sorry

end
```

---

## Key Patterns Identified

1. **Vertex Representation**: Uses `Fin n` for finite graphs with n vertices, or polymorphic `V : Type u` for infinite/cardinal arguments

2. **Custom Predicates**: Define problem-specific properties (e.g., `IsKCritical`, `IsIndependentSet`, `IsMaximalCliqueFS`)

3. **Extremal Values**: Uses `sInf` (infimum) and `sSup` (supremum) over sets of natural numbers to define optimal values (e.g., `minEdgesToBipartite`, `ramseyTuranNumber`)

4. **Cardinal Arithmetic**: For problems involving infinite graphs, uses `Cardinal` types with `Nonempty (G.Coloring Œ±)` for proper colorings

5. **Proof Structure**: Theorems left as `sorry` with documentation, allowing for future completion

6. **Documentation**: Comprehensive comments explaining problem history, references, and proof status (proven/disproved)
